dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 1417 IH: National Law Enforcement Museum Exhibits Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Young of Alaska (for himself and Mr. McClintock) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To amend the National Law Enforcement Museum Act to allow the Museum to acquire, receive, possess, collect, ship, transport, import, and display firearms, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the National Law Enforcement Museum Exhibits Act.

section.header: Authority of National Law Enforcement Museum to acquire, receive, possess, collect, ship, transport, import, and display firearms
section.text: The National Law Enforcement Museum Act (Public Law 106â€“492) is amended by adding at the end the following:

section.header: Authority of Museum to acquire, receive, possess, collect, ship, transport, import, and display firearms

subsection.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of Federal law, or any law or any rule or regulations of a State or any political subdivision thereof, the Museum may acquire, receive, possess, collect, ship, transport, import, and display firearms (as defined in section 921(a)(3) of title 18, United States Code, or section 5845(a) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986) in fulfilling the purposes of the Museum.

In subsection (a), the term State means the several States, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, the United States Virgin Islands, Guam, the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, American Samoa, and the possessions of the United States.
